title: Sync Hangs at Slot 780703
body:
### Description


### Versions (Add all that apply)

Linux -s-1vcpu-1gb-sgp1-01 4.15.0-121-generic #123-Ubuntu SMP Mon Oct 5 16:16:40 UTC 2020 x86_64 x86_64 x86_64 GNU/Linux

### Additional Information
![teku-diagnostics](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/4733314/111907689-79b08780-8a24-11eb-9307-986a44a4f963.png)

Thanks for reporting this @RatanRSur   Firstly I think that's MainNet right?  Secondly it looks like the logs are showing the console output. Unless you've set `--log-destination CONSOLE` there's probably more information in the log file which by default is `~/.local/share/teku/logs/teku.log` Hopefully that log will provide some more detail about what's going wrong.

Also, did the issue continue after restarting teku?

Still persists after restarting it, yes.

In case it matters, I was using `--ws-checkpoint` with args I got from beaconcha.in and when I looked at the logs you just pointed me to I saw that there were weak subjectivity related disconnections. I removed that arg from teku and I still see same issue.

The logs might not be complete because I didn't know about this log file when I was changing the log level through the api. I expected to see the output change on the console 😅

I also filtered the logs to just be the context around this slot's event, let me know if you need more context
[teku.log](https://github.com/ConsenSys/teku/files/6178627/teku.log)

Ok, so it definitely didn't like the weak subjectivity checkpoint and that's why the sync stopped. We should find way to make that failure more obvious since it's quite important.  I believe the checkpoint is stored which is why it's still not working.  Do you know what you'd specified as the checkpoint?

Specifying `--ws-checkpoint 0x032b800a791f871ed6ad95a32a514abb689a08a9dd2620cb576082adbbe07df6:24855` should get it going again (that checkpoint taken from https://beaconscan.com/ws_checkpoint so hopefully is actually right).
Ok, that unstuck it. Maybe it was just user error in pasting the ws point in! Thanks!
